intro: Adenosma papuana, commonly known as the Papuan adenosma, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture. Adenosma papuana is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
